title: Setup GitHub Pages repository infrastructure
description: Initialize the GitHub repository and configure GitHub Pages hosting. Create repository with appropriate name (e.g., github-repo-dashboard). Verify deployment pipeline works correctly by pushing test page.

title: Implement GitHub PAT authentication system
description: Create PAT input interface with welcome screen explaining the application. Display clear instructions with link to create PAT (https://github.com/settings/tokens/new). List required scopes: repo, read:user, read:org. Include security disclaimer about localStorage. Validate PAT by calling /user endpoint. Handle validation errors with helpful messages. Provide option between localStorage (persistent) and sessionStorage (session-only). Store validated PAT securely. Never log or transmit PAT except to GitHub API.
notes: Completed implementation: Created auth.html with PAT input interface, comprehensive instructions and security disclaimer. Implemented auth.js with GitHub API validation via /user endpoint, scope verification, error handling, and storage options (localStorage/sessionStorage). Created common.css for shared styles and auth.css for authentication page. Added redirect logic to index.html. Created placeholder dashboard.html. Token validation includes format checking, scope verification, and graceful error handling with user-friendly messages.

title: Fetch and store authenticated user information
description: Call GitHub REST API /user endpoint with authenticated PAT. Retrieve user profile including login, name, avatar_url. Store user information in localStorage following documented schema. Display user avatar and name in dashboard header. Handle API errors gracefully with retry option. Validate API response structure. Use user info for subsequent API calls requiring authentication.
notes: Completed implementation: User information fetching and storage was already implemented in auth.js during requirement #2. Enhanced with shared API utility library (api.js) that provides: githubAPI() for authenticated requests, fetchUserInfo() to retrieve user profile, initUserInfo() with caching, displayUserInfo() for dashboard display, requireAuth() for page protection, and clearAuth() for cleanup. Dashboard now displays user avatar, name, and login with improved styling. User info validates on page load and handles errors gracefully with retry capability.

title: Fetch and manage user organizations
description: Call GitHub REST API /user/orgs endpoint to retrieve all organizations the authenticated user belongs to. Store organization data (id, login, avatar_url, description) in localStorage per documented schema. Display organizations in UI for filtering and selection. Support filtering repos by specific organization. Show organization avatars and branding in UI. Enable bulk operations at organization level. Handle organizations with no repos gracefully. Cache organization list with 30-minute TTL per caching strategy.
notes: Completed implementation: Added comprehensive organization management to api.js including fetchOrganizations() to call /user/orgs endpoint, storeOrganizations() and getStoredOrganizations() for localStorage persistence, isOrganizationsCacheValid() with 30-minute TTL, initOrganizations() with caching and stale data fallback, and getOrganizationByLogin() lookup. Dashboard displays organizations in grid layout with avatars, names, and descriptions. Handles empty state gracefully. Organizations data includes id, login, avatar_url, description, and url per documented schema.

title: Fetch repositories from user and organizations
description: Implement multi-source repository fetching. Call /user/repos with params: type=all, sort=updated, per_page=100, affiliation=owner,collaborator,organization_member. For each organization, call /orgs/{org}/repos with params: type=all, sort=updated, per_page=100. Handle pagination to retrieve all repos. Merge results from all sources. Store repo metadata including id, full_name, name, owner, owner_type (User/Organization). Cache repo lists with 5-minute TTL per documented caching strategy. Handle rate limiting gracefully.
notes: Completed implementation: Added comprehensive repository fetching to api.js including fetchAllRepositories() with pagination support (100 per page), fetchUserRepositories() calling /user/repos with params type=all, sort=updated, affiliation=owner,collaborator,organization_member, fetchOrganizationRepositories() for /orgs/{org}/repos, fetchAllUserRepositories() that merges and deduplicates from all sources, Repository caching with 5-minute TTL using getCachedValue/setCachedValue from storage.js, initRepositories() with cache-first strategy and stale data fallback, Helper functions getRepositoryByFullName() and getRepositoryById(). Stores full repo metadata including id, full_name, name, owner, owner_type, description, stats, language, timestamps, and archived status. Handles rate limiting gracefully by returning partial results on org fetch failures.
